tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: saw that her son was dead
tn.text: "became aware that her son was dead"

tn.ref: she arose and killed all the royal children
tn.text: Athaliah did not personally kill the children. AT: "she commanded her servants to kill all the members of Ahaziah's family who might become king" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: took Joash son of Ahaziah, and hid him away from among the king's sons who were killed, along with his nurse; she put them into a bedroom. They hid him from Athaliah so that he was not killed.
tn.text: "took Ahaziah's very young son Joash and hid him and his nursemaid in a bedroom in the temple. So he was not killed." (UDB)

tn.ref: He was with Jehosheba, hidden in the house of Yahweh, for six years, while Athaliah reigned over the land
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Joash and Jehosheba hid six years in the house of Yahweh as Athaliah ruled the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"kingdom"
This continues the story of what happens after Joash, the son of King Azahiah, was hidden in the temple after all King Azahiah's other descendants were killed.
"In the seventh year of Athaliah's reign" or "In year 7 of Athaliah's reign" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
the high priest (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a particular group of the royal guards.
Jehoiada, the high priest, had these military men report to him at the temple. AT: "had them come to meet with him at the temple"

tn.ref: Then he showed them the king's son
tn.text: Jehoiada revealed to them that Joash, King Azahiah's son, was still alive.
Jehoiada continues giving directions to the soldiers who will protect King Joash.
They were to keep watch for the purpose of protecting the king from harm. AT: "in order to protect King Joash" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
A rank refers to a line of soldiers. AT: "Anyone who tries to go past you while you are protecting King Joash"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must kill him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: You must stay with the king when he goes out, and when he comes in
tn.text: These two opposite things are a merism that refers to everything the king does. AT: "You must stay near the king at all times" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
This refers to the officers who supervised the royal bodyguards and the palace guards. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:2ki:11:04|11:4]].
"Each commander"

tn.ref: were in the house of Yahweh
tn.text: "were stored in the temple"

tn.ref: from the right side of the temple to the left side, near the altar and the temple
tn.text: It is uncertain whether the word "house" here refers to the temple or to the palace. Some versions translate the first two occurrences of "temple" as "palace." These versions say, "from the right side of the palace to the left side of the palace, near the altar and the temple."

tn.ref: brought out the king's son Joash
tn.text: Jehoiada, the high priest, brought king Ahaziah's son, Joash, out from the temple apartment where he had been raised in hiding.
"presented him with the book of the law"
The priest poured olive oil on the head of Joash as a symbol that he was now the king. AT: "poured some olive oil on Joash's head" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
Clapping their hands was a sign of the happiness of the people at the anointing of the new king.
This refers to the noise made by all the soldiers.

tn.ref: she came to the people in the house of Yahweh
tn.text: "she came to where the people had gathered at the temple"

tn.ref: She looked, and, behold, the king was standing
tn.text: Here "behold" emphasizes that she was surprised to see Joash. AT: "When she arrived, she was surprised to see King Joash standing"
"by one of the pillars of the temple"
"which was the usual place for the king to stand"
the people who played the trumpets
She tore her clothes to express that she was very upset and angry. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_symaction]])
"You are traitors! You have betrayed me!" (UDB)
This refers to the officers who supervised the royal bodyguards and the palace guards. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:2ki:11:04|11:4]].

tn.ref: Bring her out between the ranks
tn.text: Ranks are lines or rows of soldiers. The probable meaning is "Take her away between two rows of guards" (UDB) or "Lead her away with a row of soldiers on each side of her"
It is implied that a person who followed her would be trying to help her. AT: "Anyone who follows to try to rescue her" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: they seized her as she reached the place where the horses enter the palace grounds
tn.text: Some versions translate this as "the guards seized her and took her to the palace, to the place where horses enter the courtyard."

tn.ref: also between the king and the people
tn.text: "also made a covenant between the king and the people"

tn.ref: all the people of the land
tn.text: This is an exaggeration to show that a large group of people tore down the temple of Baal. AT: a large number of the people of the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
"the temple of Baal"
This is the name of a male priest. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
They take the new king, Joash, from the temple to the palace.
This refers to the officers who supervised the royal bodyguards and the palace guards. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:2ki:11:04|11:4]].
This is the name of a particular group of the royal guards.

tn.ref: brought down the king from the house of Yahweh and they went into the king's house
tn.text: "brought the king from the temple to the palace"

tn.ref: all the people of the land rejoiced
tn.text: This is a generalization. It is possible that some did not rejoice. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
"the city was calm" or "the city was peaceful"
"Joash was 7 years old" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
